content:
Is there way to tell Lean to re-typecheck a specified constant (or list of constants), and all its dependencies (but nothing else), given a Lean.Environment (output from Lean.Elab.Frontend, for example)?

For context, I've been making small changes to the Lean kernel (e.g. disabling proof-irrelevance) to see what errors come up when I do so. I've added flags to Lean.Environment to control whether these changes take effect, and the plan is to wrap this function (if it exists) to activate these flags before typechecking.
@Rish Vaishnav see lean4checker. The function you are looking for is Environment.replay.
(And: fun learning experiment, but please don't plan to go anywhere with this. :-)

Oh wow, that is exactly what I needed, thanks! I'm just doing this because in my translation project from Lean -> Dedukti I'll need to find a solution for how to encode proof irrelevance, so in the meantime I just wanted to see what subset of constants I can feasibly translate (and possibly patch others using axioms for the time being). I guess I should have explained that hahaha
